main event: One round crescent-shaped object was observed in Tupelo, Mississippi on November 25, 1956.
interesting points: The object had one side dark orange and the other side light orange., The sighting lasted for 10 minutes., The object started in the South, circled to the West, and disappeared in the North., Observers described the object's speed as varying from slow to fast., There were multiple conclusions drawn indicating it was probably a balloon.
witness description: Mr. Kenneth Stanford and Mrs. Stanford from Tupelo, Mississippi
